intro: Corunastylis archeri, commonly known as the New Zealand star sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant typically grows in wetland or riparian habitats, characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are usually pale green to brown, and it produces small, three-angled fruits. Corunastylis archeri is often found in damp soils and is an important component of native wetland ecosystems.
